instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1534: What is A1534? A1534 is a model number for a 12 inch size Macbook  from years 2015, 2016 with EMC 2746, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00045, 820-00244..
definitions.820-00045: What is 820-00045? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-00244: What is 820-00244? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: [SOLVED]water damage <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> with no backlight
threads.message: I got a macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2015 that came in with water damage. It turns on completely but the image is very fainted. It looks like there is no backlight. I cant find any schematics for this model. Anyone knows where the backlight circuitry is on this board? or what i should be checking? Thanks!

threads.title: [SOLVED]water damage <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> with no backlight
threads.message: Diagrams for both <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> and <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> are available....

threads.title: [SOLVED]water damage <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> with no backlight
threads.message: After troubleshooting the backlight circuit with the schematics. the issue was due to corroded led connector on the screen. i replaced it and now the backlight works properly. You can close this one. thanks!
